website_summaries.verdict: Admired for its impressive adjustability and helpful accessories despite its affordability.
pros: Built-in mouse tray can be used on either the right or left sides, or stowed underneath keyboard tray

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: This tray works perfectly for me, I do not see why some say the mouse tray feels flimsy it feels as solid enough to me of coarse if you jiggle it around it is only a piece of plastic hanging off the side but feels solid with you hand resting on it. Anyway installs easily I didn't use template just measured much easier to me unless you can flip your desk over. I searched all over for a decently priced tray and was pleased with my decision.
customer_reviews.author: Dustan Dennington

customer_reviews.title: This was very easy to install and works perfect
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and was packaged well. This was very easy to install and works perfect. We have 2 pc's in our streaming radio studio and no room for two keyboards and two mice. So this was the perfect item to solve that problem.
customer_reviews.author: ReliaStream

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tray, well built
customer_reviews.text: Built my own desk and this tray was exactly what I needed. Tray is well build, had no issues installing it, well built and works just fine. Had tray for over a year, still works like new, no pieces have broken off or tracks loosened up. Will purchase again when I finish building desk for upstairs room.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C

customer_reviews.title: What I dislike the most is the the mouse pad sits about ...
customer_reviews.text: I was short a couple washers in the package but assembled it without them. The slide that secures the keyboard doesn't come down far enough to secure the keyboard. What I dislike the most is the the mouse pad sits about 2 inches lower than the keyboard making it really awkward to use. I found myself not using it after a couple weeks and just have my keyboard on my desk again and straining my neck since it felt to weird to use my mouse and keyboard at different levels.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Rezentes

customer_reviews.title: it works great. Do take the time to install it carefully
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed! Our under the desk area is not wide enough to fit most of the keyboard/mouse trays, but with this retractable mouse pad feature, it works great. Do take the time to install it carefully. But once installed, it is very sturdy and works like a charm. My husband was having some issues with his neck/shoulder area and once we got this keyboard tray, the issues when away (because his hands were up on the desk so his shoulders were a bit hunched.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit a Logitech K350 and can't use a mousepad
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the K350 Keyboard for so many years, I probably have 4 or 5 of them in my office. I work in front of the computer all day, and then some more all night. Well, this doesn't fit the K350. To make matters worse, the area where the mouse goes is tiny. I use mouse pads with wrist wrests and my current mousepad hangs off about 3 to 4 inches off each side. I'm too busy to return it, so I'll eat the $25 and yes...I should have taken measurements beforehand, I just figured...it's a keyboard tray....surely it will accommodate my keyboard. Anyways, in a future redesign make it deeper and I'll update my review
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Good enough. Most professionals will need better.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good first step in making your home office more ergonomic. The value of this product is great but I would send an extra $20-$40 bucks if this is for anyone over 25 and plan to spend 6+ hours a day using it. A bit flimsy. Can't be adjusted vertically, or horizontally. The depth adjustment is a bit shallow so make sure that you install it with the correct depth upfront. I have a gaming keyboard and it's too deep for the keyboard tray and the mouse falls off sometimes because there are no stops on the mouse area. But even with that said at this price point it is easily worth what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Edson Manners

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Solution for Keyboarding/Mousing on a taller desk
customer_reviews.text: The dang thing is just about perfect for me. It's sturdy, well built, no sharp edges, plenty of room for my keyboard, the mouse tray works great. Only issue is that the front edge of the plastic cracked when I was leaning on it. (Like REALLY leaning on it.) Still it's holding up great after some super glue. Tracks are great, and the attachment to the dest is perfect. Screws were a little long though and added a divot to the surface of my laminated wood desk. Recommend using a spacer to reduce their length.
customer_reviews.author: Verna

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an extremely cheap piece of plastic. Installation is theoretically easy, but the flimsy plastic construction makes it irritating. Your keyboard flops around in a cheap, poorly thought out, plastic tray. Your mouse slides around on a flimsy, cheap, plastic extension of the aforementioned cheap, plastic keyboard tray. I have a $10 keyboard tray from Ikea that blows this thing away. What a disappointment. The profit margins on these things for Fellows is probably like 8000%.
customer_reviews.author: BrooklynNineNine

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard shelf.
customer_reviews.text: Super simple to put together, even easier to attach to my desk. The only thing I dont like is how the 'arms' that hold the track and attach to the desk are simply plastic. I would've liked to see them be reinforced a bit to protect from being bumped by my chair arms. I have yet to have it get broken, but it feels like it's a possibility. Aside from that it is VERY comfortable, it fits my gaming keyboard in it with a little wiggle room.
customer_reviews.author: G3N3T1C R3P0

customer_reviews.title: Great entry-level keyboard holder
customer_reviews.text: This is the first product of this kind that I have bought and I've been really happy with it. Installation was pretty easy and it's held up to almost a year of daily use and abuse. Pros: Cheap Works Cons: Difficult to clean since plastic part cannot be removed Mouse area is a bit small The tray slides in and out very easily, leading to the tray moving while typing. I wish there was a way to prevent this built-in to the device. Tape works though.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Its held up well so far
customer_reviews.text: It's very sturdy so far. I've had it for around 8 months and it doesn't seem to be going anywhere. My kids destroyed the one that came with the desk with a month or two. They like to lean on it. The only issue I have is that the mouse falls off the little platform way too much. It'd be much better if there was a lip around it
customer_reviews.author: Heatherlynn

customer_reviews.title: Much room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: The slider that is suppose to hold the keyboard in place does not go down far enough for most standard sized keyboards. The ridges that are suppose to help with grip are just annoying. They tray does not go down far enough to allow for a cac card reader to have a card slotted. The mouse pad is about an inch lower than the actual keyboard, making comfort difficult. It would also be nice if the mouse slot had a finish with a little more texture, my mouse keeps falling off. Literally I have used this for less than an hour and its fallen about 5 times.(Twice while writing this review)
customer_reviews.author: Contradictional

customer_reviews.title: Worked exactly like I'd hoped it would.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard tray installed ok but took a bit of engineering. I put it on the bottom of a metal desk and desk had channels and empty space where I needed to attach the supports. I put a metal wall shelf support across the bottom to attach the plastic supports and on the end with the drawers attached the slide directly to the metal cabinet by drilling holes and putting the screws into the slider from inside the drawer cabinet. This gave me a couple more inches for the part that holds the mouse. The end result was very neat and solid and worked great.
customer_reviews.author: R. G. Conant

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Was a pain to install on my desk with one person.. this may be good for some people but isn't for me, the square for the mouse is way too flimsy and too far away it just feels weird to use with my setup. This may be good if you're browsing the Internet or some other mundane task but for gaming it is far from feasible.
customer_reviews.author: Quigenator

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2014 and use it a lot, and so far it has held up. The reason I'm writing this review today is that finally one of the bolts that sets the adjustable height has snapped and the right side of the tray was hanging down. I've replaced the bolt and it works as good as before. The sliding function still works but not the most smooth (although never was). Seeing as how I've used this since 2014 with no issues I'll call this a pretty good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Swets

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE quality
customer_reviews.text: Beware! After following all of the instructions, I put my keyboard on this tray and it immediately fell to my tile floor, breaking my $200 keyboard! I’m no average joe. I work in construction, so I easily can do this little handy projects. I believe the fault lies with the plastic securing bracket. The securing screws were 3/4 inch thick and my table is two inches thick, so it should’ve been fine. The plastic mounts broke, letting the tray drop, after a few seconds of my 3lb keyboard sitting on it.
customer_reviews.author: consumer_report

customer_reviews.title: Plastic arm that attaches to bottom of the desk broke
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this approximately 2 months ago. When I pulled the tray out to use today, the plastic arm attached to right side at front broke. I am now left with a totally useless keyboard tray. I am trying to super glue, but it shattered rather badly, doubt it will hold. Would be nice if I could get this part. Picture above is part that broke. **********Changing to 5 star. ****************** Customer service was very helpful and is sending me a new part for the one that broke.
customer_reviews.author: BBice

customer_reviews.title: POS Breaks due to poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for less than two years, and it broke. The label says it can handle up to 50lbs, but it didn't last the weight of my keyboard and mouse. The POS broke while I was typing, and now I've got screw holes in my desk. I've either got to replace this with another or find a try that fits in the same space. The rivet on the right side snapped. Now my tray droops to the side. Save your money. This POS isn't worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sabetha Danes

customer_reviews.title: Nice tray, mouse pad issue
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard tray is great. That portion of the poduct has no issues what-so-ever. I was trying to switch the mouse tray to the other side. There were no instructions on how to do so. I ended up breaking it trying to get it moved over. There are two screws that I have no idea how they intended for you to get to... Didn't return it because it is great as a keyboard tray. Very sturdy and the slide works great.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Sutherlin

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: The tray itself isn't really stable. And the mouse is about 2 inches lower than the keyboard. This is a very poor design for ergonomics (or just being comfortable)
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: They thought of everything.
customer_reviews.text: Generally a well made product. One of the best parts was the way the packaging protected everything very well and all items were separated including screws and anything you might need. Slides for the draw track are of a very good quality so this thing is going to last. The instructions fold out into a full size template that helps you know exactly how far the keyboard will be offset back under the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Turtle1

customer_reviews.title: Temporary Fix.
customer_reviews.text: Tighten the screws every 2 months and don't put too much weight on it. Using this daily over a year now, it's really good in the beginning. Lasted me 6 months but some leg would detach from the desk due to loose mounts and screw. I wouldn't put too much weight on this, it's bothersome to routinely tightening the bolts so the tray don't fall. Mouse tray is usable if a pad is glued to it but it's really not that sturdy either.
customer_reviews.author: ANDREW XU

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: My last keyboard tray was falling apart and dumping in my lap so i picked this one to replace it with. It works great and was very easy to install. I did not want to turn my top over to install so i laid on my back to screw it to the desk and it was very easy. I taped the template to the bottom, drilled the pilot holes, and screwed them in. I also installed this by myself and upside down so yes the install is easy. Took about 10 minutes to install. I am a programmer so i use this 8+ hours a day. If anything changes i will update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Singletary

customer_reviews.title: practical keyboard drawer
customer_reviews.text: The size of this keyboard drawers ample for most applications and maybe too large for some. The quality is as expected for the price range and will perform as expected provided is has been installed according to manufacturers design. It works wells pad pull out feature that you really must consider when mounting the drawer as to provide room for in to fully extend and retract without hinderance. The item did not exceed my expectations but fulfilled my needs as I thought it would at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: I have not been happy with this tray. The screws have fallen out. I've tried replacing them, but the replacements haven't worked well. I suggested buying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy O

customer_reviews.title: Installed on Autonomous Standing Desk
customer_reviews.text: If you follow the layout paper for installation this will not work with the standing autonomous desk however I moved the back mounts behind the crossmember or frame so that it could be mounted and lines up almost perfect with the front of the desk when its pushed in. So worked out just fine. Feels firm and solid no complaints and is priced very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: smilebrightrado

customer_reviews.title: I was extremely disappointed with this item and with their return policy
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely disappointed with this item and with their return policy; the keyboard appears to be made of cheap plastic and is poorly constructed. The underside of the keyboard is not enclosed or properly finished to prevent possible cuts and scratches. The mechanism for moving the tray in and out also exposes people to of the same. I cannot, in good faith, recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: MsNan

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad keyboard drawer at all
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this isn't a bad keyboard drawer. I like that I can adjust how low it hangs below the desk and that I can keep the cats off of my keyboard way more easily now!! My only qualm about this thing is the little slide out tray for the mouse. It seems a bit awkward. Maybe I just need to get used to it. It was easy to install, but you'll either need a roll of duct tape or a pair of extra hands to help hold it in place until you get the screws started.
customer_reviews.author: HezziiTop Contributor: Crochet

customer_reviews.title: For small budget an Average product.
customer_reviews.text: I had an ergonomic keyboard that I couldn't use with this keyboard tray. The clip in the back that secures the keyboard on the tray is to small and doesn't hold the keyboard on the tray. It was easy to install. But I have built lots of things before. Took about 30 minutes to install. Seems a little flimsy. I would like to buy a sturdier one.
customer_reviews.author: MarkH

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these years ago when we updated our office. The mouse shelf eventually...we are talking years here, folks...broke off when I leaned on it too much . Totally my fault. Anyway, bless Fellowes because the replacement I bought fit perfectly into the slides and hardware that was already there. I am so glad they had the forethought to keep a good thing going and continue with what works. I only had to screw in the new base unit and I was good to go. I know this one will last several years, too. Thanks, Fellowes.
customer_reviews.author: L. Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Pretty small overall
customer_reviews.text: It's the only keyboard mount I found that had a low front-back profile (no giant metal bar/plate) AND had a retractable mousepad. It's great all around, but the only comment is: The tray does not lock when extended but only when retracted. If it had a way to lock the tray somewhere, anywhere, you'd be golden.
customer_reviews.author: WLH

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. The tray comes with the instructions as well as 1:1 template. It took me about 10 minutes to install this. The keyboard tray has ball bearing roller slides that makes it easy to slide the tray in and out. The mouse pad had a sliding piece to it, but no smooth ball bearings. Which is okay.
customer_reviews.author: Stanward S. M. Oshiro

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy mouse support, bad ergonomics for the mouse rest
customer_reviews.text: Mouse pad feels flimsy. The tray doesn't go in enough for my keyboard. All of which I'd be fine with if the mouse pad wasn't lower than the rest of the tray. It makes using the mouse very uncomfortable. I've thought about using something to raise the mouse pad tray surface up to the level of the keyboard, but I shouldn't have to.
customer_reviews.author: Zak Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: Not Ideal for Mac keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Using this with MAC keyboard doesnt provide the right angle to the wrist since this is a bit shallow and the keyboard is very slim. I had to keep a book under the keyboard to raise it up a bit to be able to type ergonomically. Also the mouse pad placement is not ideal as its way below the keyboard level and you have to constantly move from there back to the keyboard. overall the product is very sturdy and was easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Manik007

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I have a combination craft/sewing table/ office desk. Although it is the perfect height for crafting and sewing, it is too high to be comfortable when using the keyboard. This really did the trick. I especially liked the little side piece for the wireless mouse. I would definitely buy this again. One thing that I did learn was that if you want the unit to completely be flush with the edge of the desk, move the template back an inch or so
customer_reviews.author: Linda Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard Tray!
customer_reviews.text: I bought to replace the 21 year old tray that came with my desk that had become wobbly in recent years. I installed it further back than the original & it pushed back & pulls out farther than it ever did. I bought a large mouse pad to fill the recessed tray & it works better than I ever hoped it would!
customer_reviews.author: David Culwell

customer_reviews.title: A Perfect Fit For My Needs
customer_reviews.text: I have a small desk in my room and this under-desk keyboard freed up a lot of real estate. I took me about an hour to install (you will need a drill and the proper sized drill bit per the instructions. I did not have to use the template). It looks and feels nice. When it slides in, it snaps in securely. The slide in-and-out action is smooth. I noticed that armrest surface is fingerprint resistant. This was a good buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: rharris

customer_reviews.title: easy to install but small
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect under the desk but very small keyboard tray and if you have a tall ergonomic mouse it won't fit under the desk to slide it back. Very sturdy and easy to put together, the manufacture could have left most of it together though instead of making you put in 8 screws before installing it.
customer_reviews.author: Erica S.

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable product with its price
customer_reviews.text: With all of us stuck working or studying at home. I just need to get my kids a better ergonomic settings than they used to have since they spend even more time on their desk with the compute now. It works fine with its price. The reason for this compare to the more adjustable swing arm ones is that it is small enough to get under my kid's desk.
customer_reviews.author: supra0083

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed! I have already contacted Amazon and see what ...
customer_reviews.text: Two screws busted open and fell off within a month. I tried to screw it back but it won't stay as the screws busted open within several minutes. The screws cannot hold the tray for normal usage. It could injure your knee or feet if it fell off all of sudden. It is no longer functional and is a safety hazard. Extremely disappointed! I have already contacted Amazon and see what solution it will offer.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: WORKS FINE
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were very easy. The thing is sturdy enough to do the job without problems. No, you cannot put a lot of weight on it and it is not made to be roughhoused with. But if you use it like an adult and treat it with normal use this keyboard drawer should last for many years. For the money, it is a great investment. I am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Designed to fail with 0 quality control
customer_reviews.text: This is impossible to set up as it is. The screws provided for step 2 are literally about 60% as long as you’d need them to be to work. It also didn’t come with a drill template. That’s not even counting the fact that if you use the screws they provided for step 2 as directed, you’ll immediately see how little these people cared for quality control! Chinese garbage, I’m guessing. Either way, I’m infuriated. This product was for work - no more Chinese products for me.
customer_reviews.author: AngryPersian

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these since we are now able to work from home. They are made of heavy duty plastic and appear as if they will hold up well. If either one of them happens to break within the next 6 months, I will edit my review. They work smoothly and were very easy to set up
customer_reviews.author: Penguin

customer_reviews.title: Ya get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice tray for the price. It was kinda a pain to install, but after I got it on my desk, I don't have any worry that it's going to snap off or anything. That being said, it is made of plastic, so if you don't brace it on your chair, it tends to "wobble" while doing fast typing. If anything changes, I will update this.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Evans

customer_reviews.title: NOT Made in China!
customer_reviews.text: I like this very much overall, and I was happy to see that it was made in Taiwan, rather than China. It is very smooth, and the instructions are very good. My only complaint is that the mounting screws were too long, and tried to come through the top of my computer desk.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McGrath

customer_reviews.title: Saves keyboard from cats.
customer_reviews.text: I always had a problem with my cat laying in my keyboard but this has finally saved my keyboard from my cat. It feels very sturdy and does its job. It pulls in and out very smooth without any issues. The only thing I would have to complain about is when I type my whole desk kind of moved with it, but other then that it is exactly what I wanted and for a cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: Twitchin

customer_reviews.title: Yoga block saves the day
customer_reviews.text: Tray worked well for keyboard, but the mouse extension is too low and poor ergonomically. Fortunately I have as easy solution to share. A lightweight yoga block fits nicely, and raises the mouse platform up just enough to be far better on the wrist and elbow angle. See my picture.
customer_reviews.author: Mid Mich Bob

customer_reviews.title: Lack of instructions
customer_reviews.text: There isn't any info to remove and renstall the mouse tray. I must be removed to gain access to all the plastic around the main tray. All the sccessories, screws brackets, etc. are under the plastic. It is not possible to install the screws for the bracket just above the mouse tray. The method I used was to remove two of ( there are three for each bracket ) the front slide screws. lifting the slide from the keys and sliding away from the tray. Side the tray back and remove. After completely installing the keyboard tray, re-install the mouse tray.
customer_reviews.author: James Whitby

customer_reviews.title: great keyboard tray, only one complaint
customer_reviews.text: this is a great product but there's one drawback. some of the screws they include are so small that they are prone to coming loose over time from daily use of the tray. seems like every couple of months I'll notice a screw lying on the floor at my feet. eventually I just added some glue to one of these screws and it's staying put. none of this affects the function of the tray. it's just a small annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, packaging needs protecting in transit.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a great product. The reason I only gave it 3 stars is due to the packaging in transit. It arrived in its original box, but not padded or protected in any way. Therefore, I wasn’t too surprised when I opened the box and found a corner was cracked and broken. As far as the actual use of the product, well, it’s great! Totally does the job - my desk at work is a little high for my chair height, so I wanted this to bring the keyboard down a few inches. Perfecto! I just wished it was packaged better for transit.
customer_reviews.author: Sky's mummy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard drawer - good value.
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this keyboard drawer. Once installed it is very sturdy (the specs say it can handle 50lbs of weight). There are two reasons I did not give it four stars. The first is that the height of the tray cannot be adjusted without removing the entire drawer (removing all 8 screws holding it up). The second is that under many circumstances the mouse tray cannot be extended if the drawer is mounted in such a way that its front is flush with the edge of your desktop when you push it in. For newer desks this will not be an issue, but if you have a narrow space it could be.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Smith

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, Quality keyboard tray
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive but solid keyboard drawer. They have a template for mounting that works. If I wanted to, I could move it a little further under the desk. The front protrudes a couple of inches in the standard mounting position. I left the tray at it's maximum depth and it works perfectly. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: SGW

customer_reviews.title: Another purchase that makes my home office life 100% better.
customer_reviews.text: More than enough space on the keyboard tray for my simple keyboard and mouse. Raised grooves on the tray keeps my keyboard from moving up & away from me on the drawer. Moves out and in smoothly. Diagram and template made following instructions easy. Six screws on each side and it was installed. Most importantly it freed up a lot of real estate on the desk for me to write on. Last picture is pre-install of my awesome Fellowes Drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Ron U.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for its price
customer_reviews.text: At first glance it seems brittle and wobbly...but I have to admit it does hold well and works greatly. I had purchased the prior version several years ago. But the side glides much smoother and quieter. The installation is simple if done correctly. I recommend using a power drill to punch through the wood...it will make the job much easier...much easier. I purchased a second one for my wife. There is no wobble and decently sturdy. CONS: for its price...expect it to feel brittle and cheap... PROS: Cheap price Simple Installation (with Power Drill) Easy Glide Retraction/Extension Overall...a great product for its price. FULCRUM
customer_reviews.author: Joel Sulkes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install!
customer_reviews.text: At first when I noticed it wasn’t going to fit my 12in length table, I’m like I don’t want to deal with this is I’m going to have to do something extra so I’m like let me ask my dad for help as a 22 year old girl , i just rather him do everything ... happens to be he’s busy and I’m impatient so I decided to give it a try, so easy to build and comes with everything you need! Mine does stick out a little since My table is 12in & mounted, so I’m able to give it a little space as pictured above, I’m so in love with it can’t wait to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Very solid feeling, even if plastic.
customer_reviews.text: I am not quite used to the mouse shelf being lower than the level of the keyboard. The built-in wrist rest is something I didn't know would be so comfortable. All in all, a great replacement for the keyboard drawer I broke, saved me from having to replace the whole desk.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and reliable but needs adequate space under desk
customer_reviews.text: This product is sturdy and reliable, but it needs adequate space under your desk to install. If you have a bar or ridge in the middle underneath, it won't fit. I found this out and had to return it, but I wanted to give it a good rating because it was fine save for my own particular setup incompatibilities.
customer_reviews.author: jeffbezosisbald

customer_reviews.title: MEASURE THE WOOD
customer_reviews.text: I had to get washers to make this work, because I didn't measure the surface first. Once that got resolved,it was EASY to place. You might want to do this before you flip the desk top side up! Very helpful shelf, easy to put together, sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: DCross

customer_reviews.title: Used Item - 2 broken pieces and a cracked front!
customer_reviews.text: I have never ordered a “used item” so when this came I was disappointed as there were two plastic pieces on the bottom broken plus the front piece was cracked. We were able to make it work - used different brackets as I needed it to work from home full time; however I was very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Does not feel sturdy at all but it is still comfortable. If you plan on using this for working all day long, it is probably not the one for you. I like that it comes with three height levels, although it is not possible to switch between them easily. Overall it is a good product for short durations of typing. One word of caution: once the tray is out, small amount of force is enough to slide it back. I found my keystrokes enough to slide it, so I had to come up with my own method of stopping it from sliding.
customer_reviews.author: rvimal

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I originally had this tray installed about 15 years ago. This is my daily work computer and it eventually broke. I purchased a much more expensive product to replace it. I hated it and even though it was FULLY adjustable, it would not adjust high enough to accommodate chair height, knees, etc. I went ahead and through that one out and ordered this one again. This is a bargain!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than buying new desk
customer_reviews.text: This replaced the keyboard tray that came with my desk. Install is a little challenging, especially if you don't want to remove everything from your desk. Getting everything aligned for full open and close capability was a struggle, but I am happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Craig L

customer_reviews.title: For the price, an overall satisfactory underdesk keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat of a challenge to install, but performs well otherwise. Word of warning: If you install the unit using the provided template you will find that, when closed, the keyboard will not be flush with the edge of the desk. You can avoid this by installing the mounding braces somewhat further back under the desk, but this will shorten the depth of the tray somewhat.
customer_reviews.author: DatGuy

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Apple keyboards
customer_reviews.text: For this item where the keyboard sits is too deep for my Apple keyboard. I am going to have to come up with a solution to raise my keyboard up just a bit so my hands are not reaching down into the keyboard tray to type.It would have been perfect otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Durable, practical and good looking.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2013 and up until now it had worked great. Due to heavy duty it's only natural that the mouse drawer broke off. I will try to fix it since I love tweaking things and I would love to keep using this Fellowes drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Sure helps when you're working from home they have a keyboard tray. Customer service was great and sent me a replacement due to a defective part. No questions asked did not even make me return the original. Excellent customer service. The new one works awesome exclamation
customer_reviews.author: Kim L.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t use it, but it seems pretty decent.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this didn’t work with the desk I bought. I will say that I did like what I saw if it’s function. The wrist rest is solid, would be nice if it were gel or cushioned. Price was good. I would’ve kept it if I could’ve used it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I did expect more downspace and although it's working fine it's really sharp underneath around the tray and have ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as stated, but there isn't much room between where you mount and how it pulls out, not much of a down rod form where you mount under your desk. I did expect more downspace and although it's working fine it's really sharp underneath around the tray and have actually cut myself a couple time not being careful pulling it out from under the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Malinda Misko

customer_reviews.title: Nice Slide-out Tray
customer_reviews.text: The office desk had no keyboard tray. This solved the problem. Easy to assemble and install. The slide-out for the mouse is very convenient. Taping the template to the underside of the desk made mounting a simple task.
customer_reviews.author: Lily R

customer_reviews.title: Quality product with great fit
customer_reviews.text: No problems fitting this to my 2017 Tacoma. My wife and I had it on and secured in less than 30 minutes. Tight fit at all locations, no need for the weather stripping, but nice to have just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Erwin

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Makes my desk a lot more space. Installation was very easy. I am using a very simple keyboard, so it has more than enough space for my key board. But if you have really fancy big keyboard (the depths is more than 7.5”) there is a keyboard stopper, so it doesn’t work. My desk is not very thick, so the screws in the box are just a little too long. I used shorter screws which I had instead of using the ones in the box.
customer_reviews.author: kch1026

customer_reviews.title: I've bought 2 of them so far
customer_reviews.text: I broke my first one during a move and when it was time to replaced I went with this one again. Works as advertised. I wish the pulling of the mouse pad was smoother but I can live with it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Olivares

customer_reviews.title: I was fairly easy to install and is very sturdy compared to what ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this keyboard tray for my computer desk that did not include one. I was fairly easy to install and is very sturdy compared to what other people have said. It's made of plastic so understand it does not have the strength of wood, which is not a problem so long as you're not force-ably applying excess pressure. Good deal and good product!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I would give it 4 stars, but the directions were not easy to follow as it didnt really explain with screws were which. It installed good but the screws were close to going right through the top of my desk. Mouse area doesnt track well with Logitech's M550. Over all, after the issues it works well though! Would recommend but take your time on install. Its also fairly wide, way wider then you would expect and about 7 inches wider then my full size keyboard. Brackers also mount 4 inches additional in both directions so make sure your desk is bug enough
customer_reviews.author: Anthony A

customer_reviews.title: GOOD QUALITY AND. VERY NICE TO USE.
customer_reviews.text: Being. 77, of course I had some trouble connecting the unit to the underside of my desk. I had to partly disassemble the desk and put the top. down on my rug to get the job done. So, after I got my life back from all that killing work, I felt great. It really is perfect for my use. Both the keyboard shelf and the mouse pad work perfectly, and fit my desk.without any special adjustments. The quality is better than the one that came with my desk It became unusable after eleven years. This one will out last me.
customer_reviews.author: Bill McLean

customer_reviews.title: wrist rest is bothersome
customer_reviews.text: I wish it doesn't have such a big wrist rest. The wrist rest makes the tray sticks out more and hits the arm rest of my chair when I pull the tray out. It also makes the keyboard sitting deeper in the tray. My keyboard has a low profile. I need to put something under my keyboard so it more flush with the wrist rest. It's not a bad keyboard drawer and is pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Health For Life

customer_reviews.title: A keyboard tray with quality fit for a king and instructions easy enough for a fool
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard tray came quickly and was exactly what I was looking for. The instructions were easy to follow and the install was a breeze with the included template. The casters for the sliding brackets work quietly and smoothly, so to does the mouse tray when you pull that out. If I ever need another one I will purchase again happily.
customer_reviews.author: ian

customer_reviews.title: Fellowes Office Suites Underdesk Keyboard Drawer Does Not Fit
customer_reviews.text: For anyone wondering, the Fellowes Office Suites Underdesk Keyboard Drawer does not fit A Logitech G510 Gaming Keyboard. I'm getting a new keyboard soon and I suppose this underdesk drawer narrows down my choices, but I do like how sturdy it feels. That and of course now it's installed under my desk. Be sure to measure your keyboard before ordering this product though.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Moneymaker

customer_reviews.title: Decent product.  A bit flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse area on this thing is tiny. Most people probably would not mind this, but I am a gamer and having only a 6 x 6 area to move your mouse is kind of a deal breaker. Had to secure a board to the using adhesive strips. Quality leaves a bit to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Towson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small desks
customer_reviews.text: Installed on my sons small desk to free up space. Easy and quick to install. Long screws for composite desks so I swapped them out for 1/4 shorter ones to ensure I didn’t go thru the desk. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sally A. Corrie-Herman

customer_reviews.title: Get a better adjustable/multidirectional one
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I like that its convenient. Cons: Hard to clean Wireless mouse keeps falling off Wires get caught in the back Sliders get caught on something all the time The "adjustable" keyboard holder only moves less than 1 inch, basically you slide it back so you can place a keyboard then slide it forward to keep the keyboard in place, but unless you're slamming the table backwards, it's not like the keyboard is going to fall off anyway, so it's useless and bothersome
customer_reviews.author: Premo

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be  better
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Fellowes keyboard tray I’ve bought. The other I’ve had for close to 20 years. The current version is much sturdier than the first one, but I have to agree that it is not deep enough for my Microsoft ergonomic keyboard. I recommend a small redesign so that the tab in the back can extend out a few more inches to accommodate the depth of an ergonomic keyboard. I currently have my keyboard balancing on the tray and it is working but if I was typing quickly I might have problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: I like it very much.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 2 stars because if you are installing it yourself from underneath desk ( like I did ) good luck. I still don't know how I did it. If you are able to turn the desk over to install it then you should have no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Rich K

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but it's not for ergonomic/curved keyboards
customer_reviews.text: Installation was straight-forward. Yes, as others have pointed out, this is a plastic product, but it appears to be plenty strong for it's intended use. I like the fact that this drawer/shelf has an adjustable height to accomodate different height keyboards or different user preferences. It's plenty long, almost 2" longer than my standard Dell keyboard. I used some Velcro tape on the bottom of the keyboard to keep it from sliding side-to-side. I attached my Logitech Trackball to the mouse shelf that same way. I had been hoping that the drawer would fit my Microsoft ergonomic keyboard, but that was a no-go. Before buying, make sure your keyboard will fit into the 20"W X 7-5/8"D keyboard well.
customer_reviews.author: Lost in the Forest

customer_reviews.title: replacement for an officemax desk's keyboard tray
customer_reviews.text: much better construction than the original equipment. I just installed this and I'm already impressed. my setup is a logitech keyboard with logitech trackball mouse ( I can't speak for those of you who use conventional mice).
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Holds well to my desk with 'Command Strips' for light use, also easy to drill and screw in for heavier applications. Large enough to comfortably hold a Logitech 910 during gaming sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Mitchum

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard drawer but arrived broken.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the keyboard drawer. Unfortunately it arrived broken. The slide out drawer for the mouse snapped off and the plastic is broken. I believe this might have been due to packaging/delivery. I can still use the drawer though and will definitely keep it as I really don't want to go through the trouble of repacking it and returning it. I don't think another drawer will come packaged any differently. I wish there was an option for a partial refund. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Capelli

customer_reviews.title: didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought it January 2017, and now in March 2019 it's falling apart. The plastic on one of the parts that attach to the desk is cracking apart, and on the other the rail won't stay on so i have to prop it up with on knee while at my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Rhys Passafiume

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: The instructions could have been better. I watched a video on how to install it correctly. So I managed. It took maybe 20 minutes and minimal mess. Overall I’m happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M3L8z

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have used under desk keyboard trays for years from many different companies. I purchased this one for my wife's desk and frankly I am jealous. It is extremely solid, looks good, and best of all it was very easy to install. I don't give a lot of 5 star reviews, but this item is great.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. Using it with my gaming keyboard and muse
customer_reviews.text: I have installed on my standing desk. I had to install some wood standoffs so it that it fit across the rail in the middle of the desk. I have my hands resting on it with no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Thanh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work, pain in the behind to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Took forever to understand and implement the instructions. Seemed nice enough once put together but one little bump and it popped right off the desk....after ALL that. Pfft.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca H.

customer_reviews.title: A+ product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, got frustrated with other products before I found this one and couldn’t be happier. Would recommend to anyone who needs to install a keyboard tray.
customer_reviews.author: david gravener

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Other than having to crawl under the desk to attach the tray it was easy to set up. Instructions are good. It is made of plastic with metal glides so I wouldn't put a lot of pressure on it. But simply to hold a keyboard out of the way it fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: photoguy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: With all the complaints I've ready about the quality I would have expected to receive a cheap piece of crap. This thing is more than acceptable quality for the price. Definitely better than the tray that came with my desk. I certainly wouldn't lean on it too hard, but you'd be pretty dumb to lean on a more expensive one, too. All in all, it's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Dean Turner

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, fast solution for working from home.
customer_reviews.text: This was such a good buy. Easy to install, fits my keyboard perfectly. Only downside is that it's too small to fit my wrist pad and mouse pad but I can manage.
customer_reviews.author: Toni_J

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: Installing was well thought out. I have equilibrium issues and had problems working underneath desk to install. The tray works well. The side mouse piece serves no purpose for me.
customer_reviews.author: May I Offer You A Hand

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price and function
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price. However I regret buying this tray as my monitors are not centered on the desk but yo they side. I should of bought one that is not fixed in its movements.
customer_reviews.author: CDubz

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but check keyboard fit
customer_reviews.text: This came quickly and was easy to install. They had good clear directions with a template for setting the screw holes (so dont panic). it works nicely. when installing you can adjust how low it hangs down from the desktop. I use my mouse on the left (to avoid aggravating my carpal tunnel on my right side), but I just unscrewed the mouse area and moved to the other side, easy. I will warn that I had a large fancy keyboard (with a large volume button up over the top) and it didnt fit on this keyboard. Once I got a smaller keyboard fits fine and the thing is designed so the keyboard doesnt slide all around.
customer_reviews.author: Sherlock

product_meta.title: Fellowes Office Suites Underdesk Keyboard Drawer, Black/Silver (9140305)
product_meta.description:
The height adjustable Fellowes Office Suites Underdesk Keyboard Drawer converts a conventional desk to an ergonomic workstation! Moves keyboard and mouse off the desktop to save workspace. Unit is easy to install and offers three different height adjustments to suit preferred work position. Mouse tray mounts on right or left side of keyboard tray or stows underneath keyboard tray when not in use.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Reduce desktop clutter with the Fellowes Office Suites Underdesk Keyboard Drawer. Constructed from 100 percent recycled materials, this sturdy, impact-resistant drawer lets you move your keyboard and mouse off your desk to give you plenty of room to work. Easy to install, the drawer can be adjusted to three different heights and fits standard keyboards.

Features 3 height adjustments to fit your preferred work position. View larger.ADJUSTABLE KEYBOARD DRAWER WITH GLIDE TRACK
The Office Suites Underdesk Keyboard Drawer lets you easily place your keyboard in your ideal position with your choice of three heights (2-1/2, 2-1/8, or 1-3/4 inches below track). A keyboard stopper holds the keyboard securely in place while you work, while ball-bearing glide tracks ensure the drawer slides smoothly back and forth.

STOWAWAY MOUSE PLATFORM MOUNTS ON EITHER SIDE
The keyboard drawer includes a separate mouse platform that lets you mount your mouse on the left or right side of your keyboard--wherever it's most convenient for you. In addition, the mouse platform stows underneath the keyboard tray to save space when not in use.

FITS STANDARD KEYBOARDS
The keyboard drawer's sturdy, impact-resistant tray fits standard keyboards and is constructed from 100 percent recycled materials.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Fellowes Office Suites Underdesk Keyboard Drawer with mouse platform, glide tracks, hardware, and easy installation guide.

OFFICE SUITES
UNDERDESK KEYBOARD DRAWER
AT A GLANCE:
 * Keyboard drawer with adjustable height stores keyboard and mouse under desk
 * Ball-bearing glide tracks ensure smooth operation of drawer
 * Mouse platform mounts left or right and stows underneath keyboard
 * Fits standard keyboards
 * Made from 100 percent recycled materials

RECOMMENDED COMPANION PRODUCTS AND ACCESSORIES
Fellowes Lumbar Back Support (9190701)Fellowes Standard Footrest (48121)Fellowes Standard Monitor Riser (91712) * Low-profile design for maximum lumbar support
 * Supports lower back during extended periods of sitting
 * High-density foam promotes neutral posture

 * Offers dual-position height adjustment
 * Free-floating platform stretches legs for increased circulation

 * Innovative stacking columns raise monitor to eye level to help prevent neck strain
 * Features 3 different height adjustments from 2" to 4"

Main Product Benefit
feature_bullets: Height adjustable unit features 3 height adjustments to suit preferred work position and moves keyboard and mouse off the desktop to save workspace
Mouse tray mounts to right or left side of keyboard tray or stows underneath
Sturdy, impact-resistant tray fits standard keyboards
Product contains 100% recycled materials.Glide Track Length:10 - 10-1/2 inches
